required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lu AG06466 in Participants With Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
clinical_study.official_title: Interventional, Randomized, Double-Blind, Crossover, Placebo-Controlled, Exploratory Study Investigating the Effects of Lu AG06466 on BOLD fMRI Signals and Sleep Parameters in Patients With PTSD

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of Lu AG06466 after multiple doses of 30 milligrams (mg) in participants with PTSD.

detailed_description.textblock: The crossover study consists of two treatment periods of 15 days duration. On Day -1 or Day 1 of Treatment Period 1, eligible participants will be randomized (1:1) to a sequence of treatments (either Lu AG06466-placebo or placebo-Lu AG06466) with 15 participants are planned per sequence. Each treatment period will be separated by a washout period of ≥7 and ≤14 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) Data: Mean Blood Oxygen Level Dependent (BOLD) Percent Signal Change During Facial Affect Recognition Task
primary_outcome.description: fMRI parameter estimates (β-contrasts) will be extracted per participant/treatment period from task-related regions of interest (ROIs) under task-specific contrast, Facial Affect Recognition Task

primary_outcome.measure: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) Data: Mean Blood Oxygen Level Dependent (BOLD) Percent Signal Change During Threat Processing Task
primary_outcome.description: fMRI parameter estimates (β-contrasts) will be extracted per participant/treatment period from task-related regions of interest (ROIs) under task-specific contrast, Threat Processing Task

primary_outcome.measure: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) Data: Mean Blood Oxygen Level Dependent (BOLD) Percent Signal Change During Card Guessing Task
primary_outcome.description: fMRI parameter estimates (β-contrasts) will be extracted per participant/treatment period from task-related regions of interest (ROIs) under task-specific contrast, Card Guessing Task

primary_outcome.measure: Skin Conductance Response (SCR) During fMRI Tasks
Skin Conductance Response (SCR) During the Threat Processing Task

primary_outcome.description: Behavioural Response: behavioural measures rated on a 3-point scale

primary_outcome.measure: Behavioural Measures During the Threat Processing Task
primary_outcome.description: Behavioural Response: behavioural measures rated on a 3-point scale

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep, Polysomnography (PSG) Parameters: Total Sleep Time (TST)
Sleep, Polysomnography (PSG) Parameters: Wake-Time After Sleep-Onset (WASO)
Sleep, Polysomnography (PSG) Parameters: Sleep Onset Latency (SOL)

intervention.description: Lu AG06466 - 30 mg/day, capsules, orally, once daily, one capsule will be taken daily for 15 days per treatment period
Placebo - capsules, orally, once daily, one capsule will be taken daily for 15 days per treatment period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The participant has a body mass index (BMI) of ≥18.5 and ≤35 kilograms (kg)/square meter (m^2).
- The participant has PTSD, diagnosed according to Diagnostic and Statistical Manual Diploma in Social Medicine-5 (DSM-5), and confirmed by the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI).
- The participant has a Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale for DSM-5 (CAPS-5) total score ≥28 at screening and baseline.
- The participant has alterations in arousal and reactivity, confirmed on CAPS-5.
- The participant has ongoing sleep disturbances, confirmed on CAPS-5.
- The participant is willing to discontinue all prohibited medications during the study and to complete a washout of psychotropic medication during the washout period.
- The participant does not have any magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) contraindications.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The index traumatic event that led to development of PTSD took place >15 years or <6 months before screening.
Other inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply.
